page.title: 13Caledonian Canal: 1
page.content: {The Canal and its use} The Caledonian Canal passes through Banavie. At this point it rises (or falls, depending on the direction of travel) 64 feet, through a series of 8 locks known as "Neptune's Staircase" - quite a feat of engineering and a great tourist attraction. The canal gets its water from the lochs it passes through and these are, in their turn, fed by the many highland burns. The canal, at this point, employs only three men, and is not very busy. During the summer months there is a steady traffic of mainly tourist yachts- around five yachts per day; while in the winter only the occassional fishing boat, saving herself the trip around Cape Wrath, makes the passage.
